p: Large population growth is expected throughout the 21st century, especially in developing countries. Most of this increase is expected to occur in areas with high wet-bulb temperatures, leading to a significant increase in exposure to dangerous high-temperature conditions. For the period 2070â€“2100 (30-year average), we used SSP population prediction data to estimate the number of person-days (the number of days and number of people superimposed) exposed to high wet-bulb temperatures ( Figure 6). By using 14 GCMs under the four emission scenarios, we estimated the extensive exposure uncertainty. The uncertainty is assumed to be caused by GCM variability and the uncertainty of future emission trajectories.
